Content: taddr, prefix, prefix2 are the coin specific address prefixes that are customizing the address for bitcoin vs. KMD vs LTC,e tc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
@SHossain I think you had your parameters reversed for the rewardsunlock:
"method": "rewardsunlock",
    "params": [
        "RWX",
        "8a4bb8b558dc47561e58f4eeaa5af3521689c3c32fbbf390e4975def396b4c7a",
        "c7c36c2689091103ab50e46967df354dfa63de41af4ed9c71accb96895801791"
    ]
c7c36c2689091103ab50e46967df354dfa63de41af4ed9c71accb96895801791 is the fundingtxid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: reverse them and it should work

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@dukeleto Have an idea to make alternate RPC tests package  (maybe as TUI and separate module) after this situation with regtest and CC
Just use as RPC connection with one of the existing chains same as I'm doing in TUIs
```rpc_connection = Proxy("http://%s:%s@%s:%d"%(ip, rpc_user, rpc_password, port))```
So will possible to run same tests on any existing chain in "combat" conditions. Or run a new chain with needed params and run tests on it.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Do you think it's worth?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL sounds like you want to run tests against an already-running chain? sounds like a useful option

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @dukeleto Yes, so we'll not need to hardcode chain params and even if we'll need to test few chains with different params it'll be a quite easy + possibility to test any production asset chain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: This situation when something worked well in regtest but not worked at all on non regtest chain made me paranoid üòÇ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL make it so defining an environment variable like RPC_TEST_URL=.... makes running the regtests use that instead. Just a point of warning tho, existing tests are very tied to the regtest chain, and check for exact numbers of blocks/etc.. You will need to write tests in such a way to deal with that.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Hmm,  Is it a feature that all mining rewards going to pubkey which I've set as `-pubkey=` daemon param?

Noticed that after starting a fresh chain and mining 100+ blocks I have 0 balance. Investigated:
By mistake left pubkey from different asset chain start as `-pubkey=` and in block generating tx vout funds went to address which was valid to this pubkey on different chain

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @TonyL yes

Author: Alright#0419
Content: all change address outputs will go to the address as well

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Seems like a strict to typos feature üòÉ

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Joker added some warnings to staked komodod if you don't have the key for the pubkey set imported

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not sure if they were upstreamed yet though

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That only works on setpubkey rpc, and that RPC is in all komodods I am pretty sure

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL a given pubkey is valid on any KMD chain, and even on any coin that uses the same curves. There are use cases where a node sets -pubkey but does not have it imported locally, I guess. Maybe some kind of startup message like "pubkey is not in local wallet" would be useful
